intro: Chaetospora lepidosperma, commonly known as the velvetleaf balm, is a flowering plant belonging to the Apiaceae family. It is characterized by its finely divided, feathery leaves that give it a delicate, almost silky appearance. The plant produces small, yellowish-green flowers arranged in umbels, typical of the carrot family. It is native to regions of southern Africa and thrives in moist, well-drained soils. Its botanical features make it a notable species in both horticultural and ecological contexts.
